intro: Metrosideros porphyrea var. lucida, commonly known as the silver-leafed pohutukawa, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its glossy, silver-green leaves and clusters of small, red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is often found growing along coastal areas. Its bark is reddish-brown and peels in thin, papery layers. This variety is particularly noted for its ornamental value and its ability to thrive in coastal environments.
